author: Telangana Today
title: Hyderabad shivers as cold wave brings single-digit temperatures across the city, districts-Telangana Today
text:
Hyderabad: Hyderabad shivered on Friday morning, as cold wave conditions swept across the city, recording single-digit temperatures at multiple locations.
The winter chill also impacted districts, with several districts including Kumarambheem Asifabad, Sangareddy Adilabad and Vikarabad recording single digit temperatures on Friday.
Also Read Telangana shivers: Cold wave grips Hyderabad as temperatures plunge, fog blankets outskirts The lowest minimum temperature of 8.8 degree Celsius was recorded at University of Hyderabad campus, Serilingampally and BHEL Factory, Ramachandrapuram. At Rajendranagar, the temperature was 9.4 degree Celsius while Moula Ali recorded a minimum of 9.6 degree Celsius.
Other parts of Hyderabad where the temperatures fell considerably include Gachibowli (11.5 degree C), West Marredpally (12.1 degree C), Qutbullapur (12.3 degree C), Patancheru (13.3 degree C) and Alwal recorded a minimum of 13.6 degree Celsius.
In districts, the lowest temperature of 6.5 degree Celsius was recorded at Ginnedari, Tiryani mandal and Sirpur in Kumarambheem Asifabad. The mercury fell to 6.9 degree C at Kohir, Sangareddy district followed by 7.1 degree Celsius at Bela, Adilabad, 7.2 degree C at Bheempur, Adilabad and 7.3 degree C at Mominpet in Vikarabad.
